meanings.definition: Having or showing quick intelligence or ready mental capability.
meanings.sent1: She is the smarter student in the class.
meanings.sent2: He is getting smarter with each math problem he solves.
meanings.sent3: The computer felt smarter after the software update.
meanings.sent4: Her smarter approach to the puzzle solved it in no time.
meanings.sent5: The detective's smarter instincts helped crack the case.

meanings.definition: To be more intelligent or clever than someone else.
meanings.sent1: They always try to smarter their opponents in chess.
meanings.sent2: I need to study harder to smarter my test scores.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon tried to smarter the cat in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: She managed to smarter her way out of a difficult situation.
meanings.sent5: He hoped to smarter his rival in the upcoming debate.
